Health & Safety for Licensed Child Care Providers, Module A
Section 1: Prevention & Control of Infectious Disease, Including Immunizations

Structuring and Managing the Environment to Reduce Germs

These interventions related to Structuring and Managing the Environment will help reduce the number of germs in your child care program. They include: 

Provide

Provide enough space to avoid crowding. Adequate toilets and sinks will allow each group to have their own to minimize sharing of space and surfaces.

Separate

Separate food preparation area from other areas, especially the toileting and diapering areas.

Check

Have your heating, air conditioning, and ventilation systems checked by an American Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air Conditioning Engineers (ASHRAE)-certified heating, ventilation, and air-conditioning contractor. This will minimize germs in the air particles.

Choose

Choose furniture, toys, floors and surfaces that can be easily cleaned and disinfected.
